help.description: Set up autoclean of expired invoices.
help.verbose: Perform cleanup every {cycle_seconds} (default 3600), or disable autoclean if 0. Clean up expired invoices that have expired for {expired_by} seconds (default 86400).

help.description: Don't run {command_to_check}, just verify parameters.
help.verbose: check command_to_check [parameters...]

help.description: Verify a digital signature {zbase} of {message} signed with {pubkey}
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Close the channel with {id} (either peer ID, channel ID, or short channel ID). Force a unilateral close after {unilateraltimeout} seconds (default 48h). If {destination} address is provided, will be used as output address.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Connect to {id} at {host} (which can end in ':port' if not default). {id} can also be of the form id@host
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Decode {bolt11}, using {description} if necessary
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Delete all expired invoices that expired as of given {maxexpirytime} (a UNIX epoch time), or all expired invoices if not specified
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Delete unpaid invoice {label} with {status}
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show addresses list up to derivation {index} (default is the last bip32 index)
help.verbose: Show addresses of your internal wallet. Use `newaddr` to generate a new address.

help.description: Synchronize the state of our funds with bitcoind
help.verbose: For each output stored in the internal wallet ask `bitcoind` whether we are in sync with its state (spent vs. unspent)

help.description: Disconnect from {id} that has previously been connected to using connect; with {force} set, even if it has a current channel
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Return feerate estimates, either satoshi-per-kw ({style} perkw) or satoshi-per-kb ({style} perkb).
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Fund channel with {id} using {satoshi} (or 'all'), at optional {feerate}. Only use outputs that have {minconf} confirmations.
help.verbose: Initiaties a channel open with node 'id'. Must be connected to the node and have enough funds available at the requested minimum confirmation depth (minconf)

help.description: Cancel inflight channel establishment with peer {id}.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Complete channel establishment with peer {id} for funding transactionwith {txid}. Returns true on success, false otherwise.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Start fund channel with {id} using {amount} satoshis. Returns a bech32 address to use as an output for a funding transaction.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show information about this node
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show logs, with optional log {level} (info|unusual|debug|io)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show route to {id} for {msatoshi}, using {riskfactor} and optional {cltv} (default 9). If specified search from {fromid} otherwise use this node as source. Randomize the route with up to {fuzzpercent} (default 5.0). {exclude} an array of short-channel-id/direction (e.g. [ '564334x877x1/0', '564195x1292x0/1' ]) or node-id from consideration. Set the {maxhops} the route can take (default 20).
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: List available commands, or give verbose help on one {command}.
help.verbose:
help [command]
Without [command]:
  Outputs an array of objects with 'command' and 'description'
With [command]:
  Give a single object containing 'verbose', which completely describes
  the command inputs and outputs.

help.description: Create an invoice for {msatoshi} with {label} and {description} with optional {expiry} seconds (default 1 week), optional {fallbacks} address list(default empty list) and optional {preimage} (default autogenerated)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show channel {short_channel_id} or {source} (or all known channels, if not specified)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: List all configuration options, or with [config], just that one.
help.verbose:
listconfigs [config]
Outputs an object, with each field a config options
(Option names which start with # are comments)
With [config], object only has that field

help.description: List all forwarded payments and their information
help.verbose: List all forwarded payments and their information

help.description: Show available funds from the internal wallet
help.verbose: Returns a list of funds (outputs) that can be used by the internal wallet to open new channels or can be withdrawn, using the `withdraw` command, to another wallet.

help.description: Show invoice {label} (or all, if no {label})
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show node {id} (or all, if no {id}), in our local network view
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: List result of payment {bolt11}, or all
help.verbose: Covers old payments (failed and succeeded) and current ones.

help.description: Show current peers, if {level} is set, include logs for {id}
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Show sendpay, old and current, optionally limiting to {bolt11} or {payment_hash}.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: List transactions that we stored in the wallet
help.verbose: Returns transactions tracked in the wallet. This includes deposits, withdrawals and transactions related to channels. A transaction may have multiple types, e.g., a transaction may both be a close and a deposit if it closes the channel and returns funds to the wallet.

help.description: Get a new {bech32, p2sh-segwit} (or all) address to fund a channel (default is bech32)
help.verbose: Generates a new address (or both) that belongs to the internal wallet. Funds sent to these addresses will be managed by lightningd. Use `withdraw` to withdraw funds to an external wallet.

help.description: Send payment specified by {bolt11} with {amount}
help.verbose: Try to send a payment, retrying {retry_for} seconds before giving up

help.description: Detail status of attempts to pay {bolt11}, or all
help.verbose: Covers both old payments and current ones.

help.description: Send peer {id} a ping of length {len} (default 128) asking for {pongbytes} (default 128)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Control plugins (start, stop, startdir, rescan, list)
help.verbose:
Usage :
plugin start /path/to/a/plugin
	adds a new plugin to c-lightning
plugin stop plugin_name
	stops an already registered plugin
plugin startdir /path/to/a/plugin_dir/
	adds a new plugin directory
plugin rescan
	loads not-already-loaded plugins from the default plugins dir
plugin list
	lists all active plugins

help.description: Send along {route} in return for preimage of {payment_hash}
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Sets specific routing fees for channel with {id} (either peer ID, channel ID, short channel ID or 'all'). Routing fees are defined by a fixed {base} (msat) and a {ppm} (proportional per millionth) value. If values for {base} or {ppm} are left out, defaults will be used. {base} can also be defined in other units, for example '1sat'. If {id} is 'all', the fees will be applied for all channels.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Create a digital signature of {message}
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Shut down the lightningd process
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Abandon a transaction created by txprepare
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Create a transaction, with option to spend in future (either txsend and txdiscard)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Sign and broadcast a transaction created by txprepare
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Wait for the next invoice to be paid, after {lastpay_index} (if supplied)
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Wait for an incoming payment matching the invoice with {label}, or if the invoice expires
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Wait for payment attempt on {payment_hash} to succeed or fail, but only up to {timeout} seconds.
help.verbose: HELP! Please contribute a description for this json_command!

help.description: Send to {destination} address {satoshi} (or 'all') amount via Bitcoin transaction, at optional {feerate}
help.verbose: Send funds from the internal wallet to the specified address. Either specify a number of satoshis to send or 'all' to sweep all funds in the internal wallet to the address. Only use outputs that have at least {minconf} confirmations.
